problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the defining condition of thermal equilibrium between two objects?
options: They are in thermal contact and exchange heat
They are made of the same material
problems.hint: No net heat flows between them.
problems.detailed: Thermal equilibrium is reached when objects in thermal contact no longer exchange heat, meaning they have the same temperature.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What happens to heat flow when two objects in thermal contact reach equilibrium?
options: Heat flows only from hotter to cooler
Heat flows only from cooler to hotter
problems.detailed: When thermal equilibrium is reached, there is no net heat flow between the objects—they exchange energy equally, resulting in a balanced state.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: If a hot spoon is placed in cold water, what occurs until equilibrium is reached?
options: The spoon and water reach the same temperature
The water becomes colder and the spoon stays the same
The spoon cools and water stays the same
problems.hint: What is the heat flow at equilibrium?
problems.detailed: Heat flows from the hot spoon into the cold water until both reach the same temperature—this state is known as thermal equilibrium.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Why is thermal equilibrium considered a natural state for systems?
problems.hint: Natural processes tend to reduce differences.
problems.detailed: Systems naturally progress toward minimizing energy imbalances. Thermal equilibrium represents such a balanced state where no net heat flows.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of objects in thermal equilibrium?
problems.detailed: In thermal equilibrium, objects in thermal contact share the same temperature and no net heat transfer occurs; thus, constant energy imbalance is NOT a characteristic.
